title: Biome
chap_description: An ecosystem of ecosystems: the principal ecosystem of a biosphere.

title: Ayyew
chap_description: The Igorot virtue of ever increasing one’s sync with ecological cycles.

title: Biosphere
chap_description: The all-encompassing ecology of a planet (usually that of Earth).

title: Biodiversity
chap_description: The variety and plurality of species in a biological system.
relevant_chap: Chap. 12: The Means of the Mycorrhyzal

title: Cosmological Character
chap_description: The unique history, configuration, and composition of each planet that gives it its characteristic pattern of processes.

title: Dap'ay
chap_description: The central stone plaza of every Igorot village that is used for ceremonies, feasts, and storytelling.

title: earth
chap_description: Soil, ground [lowercase ‘e’]. Used with an article (i.e. “the”)

title: Earth
chap_description: The third planet orbiting the sun [uppercase ‘E’]. Used without an article.

title: Earthen
chap_description: Of the character of the Earth. [Capital ‘E’]

title: earthen
chap_description: Of the earth (i.e. soil, ground) [lowercase ‘e’]

title: Earthen Ethics
chap_description: An ethical framework for discerning the ecological color of an act, process, or enterprise based on the example of Earth.

title: Earth Enterprise
chap_description: An enterprise that strives first and foremost to enrich the biosphere by following Earth’s example.
relevant_chap: Chap. 9: The Cycle of the Salmon

title: Ecological Contribution
chap_description: A process that fully embodies the principles of Earthen ethics. A green ecological impact.

title: Ecological Consciousness
chap_description: An awareness of one’s interconnection to the cycles of life near and far, old and new, local and global.

title: Ecology
chap_description: A biological system; a part of a biome.

title: Green
chap_description: An ecological contribution: a process that follows Earth’s example by embodying all the Earthen principles.

title: Grey
chap_description: A depleting ecological impact: a process that fails to embody all the Earthen principles.

title: Fossil Fuels
chap_description: A modern term to describe the Earth’s ancient compacted carbon stores.

title: Igorot
keywords: Igorot, highlands, northern Luzon, West Philippines Sea
chap_description: The people of the highlands of northern Luzon, in the West Philippines Sea.

title: Humancentric
chap_description: A view of the world in which humans are central and separate from the natural environment around them. Also, 'anthropocentric'.

title: Cyclocentric
keywords: cyclocentric, cycle, kincentric, ecocentric, biocentric, synchony, William Henry Scott, Igorot Ayyew culture
chap_description: From the Greek Κύκλος for 'Cycle', we introduce the term 'cyclocentric' to describe kincentric cultures and their propensity to self organize around the sync and celebration of Earthen cycles.

title: Kincentric
keywords: kincentric, humancentric, anthropocentric, plants, animals, Earth, ecosystems
chap_description: In opposition to humancentric; a view of the world in which plants, humans, animals and all Earthen organisms share ancestry and origins, cycles and ecosystems.

title: Petro-Capital Economy
keywords: petro-capital economy, petroleum energy, fossil fuels, flow of capital
chap_description: An economy whose flow and generation of capital is powered by petroleum energy.

title: Plastic Sequestration
keywords: plastic sequestration, concentrating, compacting, building blocks, long-term storage, not-for-profit, consciousness, biodiversity, net-subtractive
chap_description: The process of concentrating and compacting plastic to create short term building blocks that secure and store plastic over the long-term, in a not-for-profit process that raises consciousness, supports biodiversity and is net-subtractive.

title: Plastic’s Stellar Story
chap_description: The four billion year view of plastic as carbon sequestered by the Earth, and de-compacted by humans.

title: Plastic 1.0
chap_description: The paradigm of plastic as human made and managed.

title: Plastic 2.0
keywords: plastic 2.0, Earth's process, cultivating biosphere, petro-capital economy
chap_description: The paradigm of plastic as a part of the Earth’s billion year process of cultivating the biosphere and as representation of our petro-capital economy.

title: Regenerative
keywords: regenerative, greening process, subtractive impact, additive impact
chap_description: A greening process whose subtractive impact is over twice that of its additive impact.

title: Wetʼsuwetʼen
keywords: Wet'suwet'en, Wet'suwet'en Nation, First Nations, Bulkley River
chap_description: Wetʼsuwetʼen are a First Nations people who live on the Bulkley River in the northwestern region of the Canadian province of British Columbia. The Wet'suwet'en Nation is composed of five clans, each of which has its own traditional territory and hereditary leaders.
relevant_chap: Chap. 9: The Cycle of the Salmon

title: Cylical Design
chap_description: The Earthen principle of crafting indefinite cycles that ever enriching, both socially and ecologically.
relevant_chap: Chap. 9: The Cycle of the Salmon

title: for-Earth
keywords: Earth Enterprise, for-Earth, not-for-profit, for-profit, nfp, mcclurahan
chap_description: The intention of an enterprise to strive first and foremost to enrich the biosphere by following Earth’s example.
relevant_chap: Chap. 9: The Cycle of the Salmon
